caption: I don't remember the name of the worker but they were so nice!! This game shop has SO many options ! We were visiting from way out of town so I wish I could go back again and experience the cafe part, for the time being the dining and sit down was not open (the Google listing does need to be updated but s simple call is easy enough to do to check!). They have great merch too, some of the coolest dice I've seen. Would love to come back someday! Or support an online shop from Texas (:

Shout out to Bonus Round for suggesting Parks as a solo game. I just moved to Chicago three weeks ago. With this stay at home advisory implemented, it's really hard to make friends and socialize. In the meantime, to do my part in slowing  the spread, I've picked up solo gaming as a way to entertain myself and boy did they do well with suggestions. Highly knowledgeable and friendly crew. Looking forward to buying more games from that store in future.

Very friendly staff, nice set up to help narrow down the wide variety of games they have to offer. Came during COVID times so wasn’t able to play any games there but I will definitely be there once the pandemic is over.
Staff is friendly and helpful suggesting new games and explaining the rules. Small, but well-selected menu of drinks and snacks.

If you love board games, this is definitely the spot to check out. They have a huge collection for playing and also purchase. The people here are really friendly and very knowledgeable about the games. If you’re hoping to try a new game without committing to buy, check this place out. The staff will walk you through/teach you the game if you’re unfamiliar.

Drew and Courtney were so kind, and willing to teach you any of their vast collection. Reasonable prices, friendly atmosphere, and even a thank you card in the bag. Please consider skipping amazon and buying from them instead!

We were visiting from out of town in summer 2019 and met up with Chicago family for an evening. So much fun! We played 3 different games, as recommended by staff. Owners Drew and Courtney have built an inviting and inclusive space.
Really fun environment and a knowledgeable, friendly staff.

I love this place so much. The gaming library is wonderful with lots of excellent picks at a variety of levels and interest. The staff has always been welcoming and helpful. And the food is perfect. This is one of our favorite places to spend an afternoon.
Great coffee,  helpful staff and a good place to hangout during winters !
Super helpful game suggestions and set up. Inclusive space. Great time.
I've been going to this place for more than 2 years and it's the best! Great for date night and parties! The food and drink selection is amazing; the staff is welcoming and knowledgeable.
So many fun board games and great food and drinks. Highly recommend

Attendants were very nice, good choice of coffee's. You pay 5$ to play a variety of table games which, includes a lesson to play it. You can skip the class and suggestion of a game. Nice place, pleasant young people mostly. I'm older. My son took me there. Not pricy. Gave us a ton of spicy trail mix for 5&. Good stuff
Awesome place to play board games in a really cool area to hang out in. The staff are super helpful and really nice.

Amazing vibe and the owners are SO kind, welcoming and knowledgeable. It's perfect even if you don't know many games - they'll give you great recommendations and help you set it up. Can't recommend this place highly enough!

The cover charge is way worth it given what they offer: lots of games and an experienced and friendly staff that will quickly teach you how to play so that you don’t have to spend so much time reading the rules. Great beer list too! And with the cover charge, you don’t feel obligated to keep ordering drinks/food. A great alternative to going to a bar with friends, or an interesting date night.
Chai was good. Gaming overpriced and server was rude about informing us of food minimum that we almost didn't have...

I was so excited by the idea of this place but it was very disappointing. Went to a couple of game nights there, and it's nice if you play a game and eat and get out. But after spending any more than an hour there, or God forbid starting to play a second or third game, the staff makes it a very unwelcome environment if you aren't constantly ordering drinks AND food.  The game playing fee is very reasonable and I would have no problem with an hourly rate, but that is never advertised or expressed in any way. Instead they try to force you to get mediocre food off of a very limited menu. The worst part is the dismissive way that you are treated, despite some very helpful and kind staff members. 2 stars instead of only because of the few cool servers and not bad coffee.
Everything I could ever want in a board game store - friendly staff who are happy to help and teach games, great selection of games, good food and coffee and beer 🥰🥰🥰

Go for the board games, stay for the gender-neutral bathrooms. The servers/game guides are very good at their work--impressive.  They also were very welcoming of people who had just walked in off the street with no idea what the shop was before entering.  Good people. Good games. Excellent chai!
Hummus and service were great, knowledgeable staff and all the best new board games, highly recommend, lots of fun!
Great staff great games great times.

Great experience! The owner is very helpful and can recommend any games. They have a good selection of food and drinks...they have vegan options and herbal teas!  Highly recommend this place for a night out with friends! Might be great for a birthday party too. They have all kinds of events so it's good to keep checking for any special events.

A great place to sit around and learn some new board games! The employees are super friendly and can teach you how to play any games they have available. Much easier than reading the instructions yourself

Super chill, the employee's make you feel welcomed, they advise on favorite games or even games similar to what you play but with a twist. Lots of fun hot chocolate was phenomenal great for fighting off the cold.
Staff is super accommodating and helps explain any of the games to new players. And the tables are perfectly large for board games, as you'd hope.

We had a company party here of approximately 30 people and it was so much fun! The staff were very attentive and patient when teaching us the games, and everyone enjoyed the selection of food and drink (the underage employees loved the hot chocolate, glad there was a tasty option for those under 21).  The selection of games was massive, but we were suggested a few that were a ton of fun (Concepts was a great twist on charades!)  This was the perfect location for a fun team building event, whether it be a holiday party or otherwise. I definitely will be returning with friends to try more of their games!
Really fun! Great game selection. Knowledgeable staff who are great at giving a game run through. Good drink selection. Good snack food.
Knowledge, friendly, helpful staff.  Good food, fun games.

SO happy Bonus Round came along. Before them we didn't have a full service game cafe and now we do!  I went in on a first date and the atmosphere was perfect. I had the sangria, my date had a Chai, we both ate some delicious sammies and they made it so easy for us to learn and pick games. Don't worry if you're not familiar with many board games because they'll also bring your a couple recommendations based off of the skill level and type of game you're into and they will also take the time to teach you. They're super friendly in their explanations and will even help if you get stuck along the way. Definitely was a great choice for the first date and many to come!  This is Chicago's first full service game cafe and we're super happy to have them in the neighborhood!

One of my favorite places to spend a low-key evening. Wonderful staff provide great recommendations & explain the rules & provide great service for food & drink. Dessert, coffee, & drink options are not bad either! A must visit in my opinion
Great food and drink and a well informed staff ready to help you find the right game for your group!
Fun time with good drinks and a relaxed setting

This place should just be called Chicago board game cafe, or Chicago's First board game cafe, or Chicago's best and first board game cafe. Chicago's first full service and best board game cafe.  I was lucky enough to be at the launch party a few years ago, and am absolutely certain it was launched before sometime in 2020. Shame about the lack of integrity with some of the competition, Drew and Courtney have been engendering a movement in Chicago to really get this concept off the ground and encouraging others to do the same since 2014. It has been a real labor of love for them between starting a meetup group that ran for years at various establishments prior to finally securing their own place in 2017, and I'm glad to have been some small part of it.  That drama out of the way, The food is good for playing board games while chowing down, and delicious to boot. the atmosphere is fun and inviting, it's great spot to meet up with old friends over a delicious house blend coffee, or maybe meet some new friends over some of their interesting beer selections, I think everyone will have a great time either way.
The best board game cafe in the city of Chicago hands down. I've always felt welcome and had a great experience!

The best full-service board game cafe in Chicago. The prices are reasonable and a great place to host friends without having to do any of the hosting duties. The vegetarian options are superb and I am happy that the items are shareable, unfussy, and flavorful.

Love this place. Great food, awesome staff and terrific game selection. I've brought many people with me here and the staff are so great at quickly tapping into what kind of games will be a hit with a particular group and guiding the group through it (even when you bring self proclaimed non game players). Such an inviting space - easy to get sucked into a whole afternoon there. Worth a visit - or many!

They had so many games there!! I haven’t played a lot of board games in my days but, the staff was so knowledgeable and helpful! They made picking up and a learning a new game a breeze! Also, the food was delicious. It made for a really nice date night.

Awesome place, never had anything like this in the city and it was much needed. The food is great, the drinks are extra great, and the game guides are helpful. Library of games is amazing, pretty much anything you could want- from old standards to new up and coming titles. Any style of game, any size group, they’ll make it happen. If you just want to chill and play something familiar or want to try something new with your friends, this is the spot to try!
The game selection is unparalleled and the staff is super nice and always willing to recommend and teach games!

I enjoyed the hour I spent at Bonus Round Game Café, as well as the tea, but the hour minimum policy was not explained to us when we first went in, so we did not know about it until someone from the counter came to us and said we have to buy more food/drinks or pay $10/person on top of the game tickets we bought. Our server was nice and still charged us the normal rate, but it left a bad impression of the business in my mind. Had we known about their policy we would have gladly followed it, but the way they went about expressing it to us made me feel unwelcome. I otherwise really liked the business concept and could see myself going there with friends, but this experience makes me not want to go there again in the future.
Really cool place to hang out and play games! Drink menu is limited but unique and they have a really awesome food menu that caters to different dietary restrictions.
This place is so fun! The staff is super knowledgeable as well, if you aren't sure about the rules of the games you're playing. Really relaxing environment.

We have enjoyed the Bonus Round Game cafe many times with our adult kids. The owners are skilled at suggesting & explaining new games and always provide a warm atmosphere to play games and feast on their delicious snacks and meals. We LOVE everything about this place!
The owners and workers are all amazing people. A fantastic assortment of games to play and buy too
We loved this place. Great atmosphere, wonderful staff, and very kid friendly.
Great selection of games, excellent service & staff, tasty drinks and overall great atmosphere!

You have to pay $5 per person just to play the games PLUS you are expected to spend an extra $10 on food per hour you stay.  I guess that’s fine, but they were not clear about that when we came in so I was pretty surprised when my chai costed $13! I wouldn’t have minded getting fries or something to eat, but they closed the kitchen 45 min earlier than advertised.  I suppose I’m just poor and others can afford to rent board games at this rate, I just didn’t know what I was getting myself into. I’ll stick to Dice Dojo where you can play as long as you want for free and bring your own food.

Bonus Round is by far the best establishment of its type I've ever seen in a half century of playing and working on board games.   My son and I have been there three times when visiting Chicago and agree that if we lived in Chicago we'd be there every week.   Drew, Courtney, Leticia and the rest of the staff are great at teaching games, recommending games, helping people have fun with games, and making people feel welcome.   For veteran gamers (which my son and I are) it's a great place to try out and discover new games.  But the cafe is almost more aimed at casual gamers or even non-gamers -- it's dedicated to helping people discover and enjoy games as a form of social interaction.   Go there, go often, and support this gem of Chicago.  By the way it's very convenient to get to, just around the corner from the Belmont Red Line stop.   Brilliant.
Vast selection of games, decent food and drinks menu, great service.

Great place to hangout and very friendly/helpful staff, Snacks are a bit expensive but it's understandable because entry is only $5/person to play basically as many games as u want as long as your there
Pretty good craft brews and I had a good time playing a game (I think it was called Photosynthesis) with my friends.

After a couple visits to the Bonus Round Cafe, I have to say it's left me discouraged to come back.  Overview: Nice space, great game library, poor customer service, very overpriced food.  The space itself is a very welcoming and inclusive space with gender-neutral bathrooms, a variety of sitting spaces and a surprisingly large game library with a great variety of games.  One of the initial draws of this cafe over other gaming places in Chicago is that the staff will give you recommendations of games and teach you at the table how to play the game. In my own experience though, I've never had an experience where the game has been explained well enough to just be able to play off what the staff has told me. They often gave the absolute basics and I would have to spend an additional like 20 minutes to go over the rules through the rule book which are in fairly poor condition or just missing in a few games. Now I understand that the staff don't have the time to explain all the intricacies of a game such as Root but even on a more basic game like Santorini, there were mechanics to the game which weren't explained well enough to make the game playable.  Another initial draw is that they have food and drinks available for purchase. The beverages are fairly well priced but the food is far too over priced. I ended up spending $9 for 4 very small quesadillas pieces this time and the previous time $8 for an about standard cereal bowl size of a sweet trail mix. For customers staying over an hour, they have a $15 per person minimum which the food will satisfy quickly but again, the size of the food isn't appropriate to the price.  Finally, the customer services could be improved some. While I understand that it was pretty crowded both times I was there, the staff was pretty sparse in checking up with us. It took a while for someone to came by to help us. Again, it was busy but after about 2 hours there, a different staff person came by to inform us that our customer minimum hadn't been met yet and we just hadn't planned yet to get something so needed a minute to decided on something else to get. After informing us, about 45 minutes passed and no one came by to check if we had decided on something which seemed odd given that they needed us to meet our minimum.
I want to come here all the time now.
Nice place with a lot of games. Our waitress was sweet

Excellent place to hang out with friends! So many games to choose from! The employees are EXTREMELY helpful and make the experience worthwhile. This is the place to be for good food, good drink, and good gaming! #gaming #comfortable #mustsee
Helpful staff, good drinks, fun games. Will come back.
I love this place, great games and good food!

The place is cute and has lots of good games. The prize is $5 per person and they did not charge us any extra (their menu says it's 15 per person after the first hour). We had some tea and hummus. The hummus was meh. Overall it was a good experience but we'd have rather bought the games and played at home for the money we spent ($30).
This place is unreal! Went here when I visited Chicago and can’t recommend it enough

Bonus Round rocks so hard. The owners are super cool and have made the gaming cafe a really special space. So many awesome games (seriously so many), fun drinks (fantasy themed beer!), and gender neutral bathrooms supplied with pads and tampons (THANK YOU!).  Bonus Round Game Cafe is the best, and they keep getting better.  Try the beet hummus. It's pink and delicious.

We went to this place as a group and we had to pay a bogus $15 table fee for sitting at a table and talking about playing a board game. We paid for the drinks we had, but the guy there wanted us to "pay for services" that we didn't even get... So much for a fun spot..

One of my favorite places in Chicago! A super unique experience, a great place for people looking for something fun and new to do. The staff are super friendly and helpful, the food is delicious and they do a ton of fun events. Stop reading this review and just go there. Its the freakin best.

I have been coming here consistently since just after it opened, and come under a multitude of circumstances (solo, with my girlfriend, with a larger party, just getting tea to-go, etc), so I would consider myself somewhat of an expert on the in's and out's of this place. I cannot speak highly enough of this place.  - The $5 per person table fee is ridiculously cheap considering the probable overhead of maintaining the 200+ board games they keep on a daily basis. - For that $5, you literally get a full-service experience. The staff will take your orders at the table, make recommendations for games to play based on your personal styles, and TEACH YOU THE GAMES IF YOU DO NOT KNOW THEM. I can't even imagine consistently remembering how to play so many different games! - The drinks and food are great, and pretty cheap for the quality. They have their own brand of coffee (Bonus Ground, hold for pun groans), and most of their alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks are from local companies. On the weekends, they even have pie from Bang Bang Pie! - The staff are cognizant of the atmosphere in their establishment. You don't have to worry about large groups taking over the place and making it hard for you to enjoy your own game; the owners are quick to stop things from getting out of hand. - They also have a small retail section if you want to buy that game you just played and loved.  If you plan on coming consistently, get the membership. It pays for itself if you visit 3 times in a month.  The only customers who won't have a good time are the ones who aren't self-aware. While it has "Cafe" in the title (because of the kind of food/drinks they serve), it is closer to a restaurant because of the full-service nature of the business (how many coffee shops do you know that take & serve orders directly to your table?) So if you only order a single drink per person in 3 hours, you're probably going to be asked to leave like you would in a restaurant. If you consistently don't tip the waitstaff, they're going to notice and stop serving you. The $5 is a cover charge, not an all-inclusive fee. So when you read the negative reviews... that's probably the real story.  Overall, there are so many reasons why this place has become my favorite spot in the city. Really cool idea, excellent execution, knowledgable staff, large selection of games, and a great atmosphere for playing. A++!

The idea of the bar looks awesome. Sadly, some of the people who work there are very rude. Not only they insist every hour or so that you order something when you still have your drink, but they also take ages to serve, and talk in a very impolite way. They are also rude whenever you ask them to find or explain a game for you. But last time was the worst. Me and my friends were kicked out for not giving enough tip in some coffees and chocolates. We are paying 5$ to play each time, and some of the friends are even paying a membership. Sometimes we order something just because they insist. But the main problem is not about the price or the need to order something policy. It is about the rudeness of the employees, who do never treat you well. I am paying to sit in a table and play, then why do I need to order every minute things I do not want. Make the membership more expensive or do whatever you want, but please treat your customers better. Never coming back. I forgot to say that some of the employees have been nice to us.

Solid food and drinks, and a chill vibe makes this place a real Chicago gem. They will help you pick a game and even teach you how to play it. You can tell I'm a major fan, because I'm constantly telling my friends to go to Bonus Round!

The atmosphere is fantastic, the staff is super friendly and welcoming, and there is a crazy amount of games to choose from. There are tons of snacks and sandwiches as well. The apple pie cider is amazing. Will definitely be back

The idea of this place is very good, and it is a pity that it has some rude people working there. I'll tell you some of my experiences.  This past month I have been going regularly (twice a week) to the place and gaming for two hours (sometimes just one game that lasts for that long), taking a coffe and paying the game fee which is 5 dollars (I would assume that it covers the time that you game but they do not think that way). Appart from many rude behaviours (not explaning games, or talking with all the lack of interest I've ever seen in a waiter) and many pushes to consume their food/drinks (pricey for what it is btw), yesterday we had one of the most embarassing situations I've seen in my life. The waiter came and said basically that he didn't want us to ever come back, that our tips wasn't good enough and he used some terms that made him go from rude to stirrer. I have to say that I always tip them with 15-20%, even being a student and I've tried to be as friendly as I could be, because I loved the place.  On the other hand, there are some members of the crew that are very friendly. But all in all, it is a place where you have to pay game fees + pricey drinks/food every two hours + outstanding tips (even getting terrible service sometimes) if you do not want to be kicked out. I will take the piece of advice of the waiter and never come back.

The first time I went everything was perfect. That's why I returned. But things started to go downhill from then on. I paid for a membership, so they could expect me to stop by a few times. I kept going even when I wasn't pleased with how they were treating me. Someone comes every ten minutes to ask if we want to order something else. We don't have time in ten minutes to finish what we already ordered. When we asked a "game master" to explain a game to us, he said he was busy rearranging the games. What?! Mind you, he wasn't even polite about it. There is a charge of $5 dollars to play, I should be able to play for a while without anyone bothering me, I've paid for it. Overall, what could have been an awesome experience was awful, I didn't feel comfortable there, so much harassment by the staff and not even politely. Definitely not going back. They need to change their attitude or their business will sink.

Great place to meet up with friends and play a wide range of board games. Staff is super friendly, attentive and helps explain the rules to get you started (which is a boon for the more complex games).  From a food and drinks perspective, they have  great range of food including sandwiches, snacks, desserts, beers and wines. The pies are also excellent.
Add more food items

This place is great! They serve alcohol and coffee/espresso drinks.   There was light food but we had already eaten.   The best part of course are the games!   So many options you can play for $5 (memberships available too), and the staff are game connoisseurs that help select and teach!
Played new games and had tea!
The waiter brings you your food and drinks and even helps you learn how to play the games 😍 it's such a great place, I easily spent 3.5 hours here on Thursday night.
This place is amazing! The staff is beyond awesome and it's a great place to visit with friends and play a new game.
Lots of games.

I was super hopeful about this place but the staff was so rude.  My friend and I saw it from afar and thought we would check it out. (I have wanted to play this one bored game for a while and wanted to see if they had it.) When we went in my friend had to pee so she went to the bathroom while I looked at the games.  I was then approached by the owner asking if we were staying, I explained I was just looking at the games but would be out of her hair once my friend came out of the bathroom. She very rudely told me that I had to pay for my friend to pee. Quote “you can’t just pee and use my stuff for free that’s just like, common sense. You can not leave my store until you buy something.” I apologized and said I must have missed the sign (there was no sign btw) she then told me off again saying it was common sense and how I was being so rude.  I apologized again and went to the register to buy something. I was told by another employee at the register that I was being so impolite by having my friend use the restroom.  For ignorant people like me and my friend that did not realize this place had a very strict “no bathroom without purchase” policy, I think it would be wise they put up a sign.  If the situation was handled with kindness and they politely infomed us all would be well and I would have likely came back. But unfortunately the place has left a very sour taste in my mouth :/
Fun games and knowledgeable staff.

I was in from out of town to visit family, and I came here with my siblings and their spouses for an afternoon outing. We had so much fun! Half of us are pretty serious gamers, and the other half of us have really only played the more traditional games (Monopoly, trivial pursuit, etc). Drew and Courtney (sp?) were so friendly, knowledgeable, and excited about us having the best experience possible. Not only is the gamin portion a blast, but we all had great drinks from the cafe. I highly recommend this place for a group hang out, low-key date spot, or a family bonding session like ours!

A real jewel in Lakeview. An incredible a selection of games to play for a reasonable price. The food and drinks are great. The staff are all very friendly and helpful and will show you how to play any game that you're not familiar with. The owners are wonderful, welcoming people. Few local businesses deserve your patronage more than Bonus Round.
Cute little place with lovely drinks and full of knowledgeable folk who genuinely want you to have a good time.  Great for a date, friend hangout, or whatever! Super lgbtq+ friendly space  as well.

Highly recommend this board game cafe! I have been to several game cafes in the country and I was pleased to know that they have great service, a nice collection of games (even several new titles), cozy and clean decor, decent menu of food/drinks and an easy to access location. They even have a monthly membership that would pay for itself within three visits in one month which is pretty enticing. Will definitely be returning to play more games and support this well thought out local business.
Love the staff!!! Great atmosphere!!
Best place to hang out for board games . I just love it . They have coffee, tea and beer and some snacks in their menu
Great place to learn new games. The owners are very friendly. Highly recommend making a reservation on a Friday or Saturday evening.
Perfect cafe and game place. Had the best time. Very affordable. Welcoming owners who are very excited to teach you how to play the various games.
Such a great winter activity with friends. The owners are super friendly and great at teaching/coaching games.
Love the concept. Wish the place was bigger and a bit more cozy.  The lighting dimmed a bit and more comfortable seating would help
I really, really like this place.
Excellent staff, food, beer, excellent recommendations on a game to play had a blast of a night. 15/10 would go again

I love Bonus Round Game Cafe. Their knowledge of their games & ability to pick out the right mix of games to choose from based on a few questions **AND** get you up to speed on game play is freakin' amazing. Their sandwiches are tasty & snack options satisfying  & the desserts are all from some of the best local bakeries. They have a great mix of beers & wines as well as great coffee & espresso & omg try the specialty sodas.. they're SO good. Their Ladies & Non-Binary Nights are fantastic & the vibe in the place is inclusive & welcoming. They do all sorts of events, gaming & otherwise, so it's a great idea to check their calendar to see what's happening. They regularly have open gaming nights where you can even show up solo & meet some new friends. It's a small place so if you have plans for a group of more than 5 people, it's probably a good idea to call ahead to see how busy they are and/or make a reservation just so they're expecting you. And honestly, I didn't even realize it was something that needs to be said because Cafe is in the name... but don't bring in outside food and drinks. They serve food & drinks so that's just bad form.... call ahead if it's a special occasion.

First off, the concept was amazing and most of the staff were really nice. Most of them were really helpful and very kind. One, however, was very xenophobic and made the night very uncomfortable for my wife on her birthday. Ironically there is a sign that says no "-isms" allowed here. She was very rude to us about bringing a small cake and very rude to her about her foreign ID and wouldn't accept her US issued ID. She didn't have a problem with our cake until my wife showed an ID that basically identified her as an immigrant. She knew it was her birthday and was very rude to her while taking our order. She was very passive aggressive directly toward her even though I was the one talking to her. We were the only table with almost all people of color and were treated very differently by her compared to everyone else there. It left us feeling really poorly the rest of the night because she couldn't check her biases. We are board game enthusiasts and were really happy to see a place like this but really let down by how we were treated by this one person.
Great fun! Servers were nice and explained how to play the games.

Unlike other attempts at the board game cafe, they really pulled it off. Staff will guide you to a game that suits your other interests, give you the quick rules review and check in with you to answer questions. No need to bring an outside game, someone who already knows the rules or for that matter no need to go with friends. They’ll connect you with a group and BOOM! You’re off! The good looked good. The music is low. The lighting is right for gaming. Great job, guys! I’ll be returning for sure. :) highly recommend.
Fun and cozy board game cafe. Always have a great time here. Have learned a lot of new and fun games. Food, drinks, and service are excellent!

We were visiting town from Indy and stopped by.  The owners were very knowledgeable and made some great game suggestions for our visit, and the library had great depth.  Their beverage options were quite nice, try the blueberry hibiscus tea iced!
Fun knowledgeable staff and great food to snack on. Very reasonable prices. Will certainly be back again.

I've been meaning to go to Bonus Round ever since I heard they opened this past spring, and I finally made it. Amazing!!! For only $5 you get to sit as long as you want and play as many board games as you and your friends can handle. I went with a good friend, and both of us have experience with lots of different games, and the three they suggested to us were all games neither of us had tried before.  The owners are also super friendly, and they explain the rules to you for each game. It's really nice, because you know exactly what you're doing and don't have to fuss with the rulebook for 20 minutes to figure out how the game works.  The food is also really tasty, but it's fine if you don't order any too -- nice for those who just want a cheap evening playing games with friends.  I'll definitely be back and 100% recommend!

They have a good game library to play games. It is also a relaxed quiet atmosphere if you can work without Wi-Fi. They have food and alcohol to enjoy your day more too! 😉😉  Over all it is great place to go! Check it out!
This is a great place to spend a rainy afternoon. They have so many great games to play ($5/person - no time limit), and they'll  give you quick and easy directions on how to play each of them.

Amazing selection of games! My husband and I are avid gamers and they managed to find a bunch of games we had not played before! The entire staff was very knowledgeable and always nearby to explain any rules! The drink options were delicious as well! We will definitely be visiting again next time we are in the city!

Just stopped in to check the place out and was delighted to realize the cafe is the focus and the games are there to just play and be taught how to play! They've got an incredible selection and Courtney was super friendly and helpful! I can't wait to bring some friends next time and try out some new games!
Great selection of board games. You should go there to support them!
So good.

I have been going here since the week it opened and I must congratulate Drew and his wife for this venture. The staff knows the games and takes time and effort to explain those to their patrons. They host events frequently with the "game-creators". My friend and I organized a small private event here and Bonus Round Café was the best place we could have done it at.
It's a cozy place with excellent games and a fine beer selection. Had much fun.

This place saved my vacation. We were in town for the Blues Festival, but got worn out/ rained out on Sunday afternoon. I was trying to find somewhere to buy a board game so we could gather some friends and play, when Google suggested the Bonus Round Game Cafe. Perfection! The staff were friendly and very knowledgeable. As somewhat experienced gamers, we were thrilled to get the chance to quickly learn and try out a couple of games I'd been curious about, and a few we'd never heard of. And the sodas were wonderful. It's been over a month and I wish I could go back!
It was amazing!! Great time
The food was excellent, the staff was great and there is an excellent drink menu.
New favorite place in Chicago to hang out, play games and enjoy good company!! So wonderful that they have food to offer too!!
Kind of cool place they got lots of board games you could bring your friends there sometime
Amazing place with great staff and game selection. Drinks are pretty cheap too!
Great game library, good food and drinks, and helpful staff.

Super great place!  A wonderful relaxed and clean atmosphere, very welcoming.  We had a little 4th of July meetup with friends and got seated at one of the bigger tables.  All the staff members knew the games and could explain them really well.  They were able to suggest some really good games based on our strange whims ("I want a time travel game!"  - Temporum!,   "I'd like to play something with pieces/non-traditional."  -The Climbers)  There were a bunch of different groups there; a family with a younger player, a couple of friend pairs, and our group was 5 people.  So there is something for everyone!  The food was also quite good, we had sandwiches which were very tasty (if this were near my work, I'd probably come here for the sandwiches on my lunch break.)  The sodas were quite tasty!  The only less than perfect thing was that they were out of pie. =<  Pies are delivered on Fridays.  >_>  I know when I am scheduling my next visit...  I'll definitely be back!!!!
Had to pay for a "game pass" where I've been to many other stores that are free. Meh.

We wandered in to Bonus Round Game Cafe after Pride this weekend and fell in love with the place. It's cozy, friendly, and welcoming to everyone. The owners are incredible. They helped us pick out the perfect game for our group and gave us tips on how to play. We stayed much longer than we had planned to! Oh, and the drinks were delicious too; I loved my seasonal Camp Grizzly Mocha. If you like board games or just want a friendly place to hang out, you should definitely check this place out.

This place is fantastic. It's clean and nicely designed. The drinks are delicious, and their collection is excellent. Beyond that, they're incredibly inviting to queer people, women, and people of color. They're striving to create an inclusive gaming community  and work to moderate the space accordingly. They're also extremely beginner friendly and are available to teach you the to rules and answer questions about any of their many excellent games. Whether you're looking for a gaming space that won't exclude you or just an awesome place to play games  this is the spot for you
Friendly and knowledgeable staff, interesting menu, great location and atmosphere. Huge selection of games too! Gender neutral bathrooms are a plus, and are well maintained too.

This place is a great fresh way to hang with your friends, have some drinks, and a good time. They make every game accessible, no matter if you play games all the time, or haven't played a board game since you were a kid. I'll definitely be coming back often!

Drew is awesome. He is a super nice guy and walked our relatively rowdy group through 2 different games. The food is great, although I think they would benefit from the addition of some more "standard" sodas (coke, sprite, etc.).  This place is fantastic and I will definitely be back. Great people, great food, great games.

If I could give this more stars, I would. This place is incredible, and every employee is helpful and friendly. The cola float was awesome, and the game selection is impressive. $5 per person to learn a new game and play for the 3 hours we were there is a great deal. Worst thing that happens is that you don't like the game, and you get to pick another one, and it's still included in that $5.

Awesome.  Great for adults, kids, and adults with kids. The owners are super helpful. They helped us pick games suited to the age and interests of our group — and even stuck around to explain the rules.  I can’t wait to go back.  We loved it.

Love this place.  Tons of game options, both for casual and dedicated players.  I love bringing my non-geeky friends here, because the owners are amazing at teaching and easing everyone into it, and they're really good at picking games based on what everyone's preferences.  Love coming here with my geeky friends as well.  There's just so many options for games here that you can find something for pretty much everyone.  The space is brightly lit, which is a must when you're looking for a place to play board games.  When I'm going to be playing for hours on end, it's a big deal to not have to squint and read in low lighting.  It sounds pricey to pay $5 per person every time, but honestly it's a great deal because I save so much from not having to buy any of these myself.  Overall, great addition to the neighborhood.  Would recommend anyone to check the place out regardless of whether you're into board games or not.
So many good games. Good beer.
Great game selection. Good customer service to help pick and teach games as well as serve the table's food and drink needs.

The owners are fantastic and super knowledgeable about all the games so they can help you pick the right one for you AND teach you how to play it! The homemade dill hummus is one of the most delicious things I've ever eaten in Chicago. The awesome coffee drinks and local beers add to fun - I could (and did) hang out here for hours! I could not recommend it enough.

We had family visiting from out of town, and this would up being a perfect place to relax in the evenings. The café is open until midnight, so we stopped by after we finished sightseeing to wind down with beverages and board games. We visited on both a Saturday and Sunday evening—our guests liked the first night so much they begged to return the next night!  Each night, the "Game Guides" did an excellent job making suggestions. (As a family, we were enthusiastic but not particularly knowledgeable—we told the "Game Guide" what sort of games we liked to play and what we were hoping to do, and they brought us a small selection that we could easily chose from. We played multiple games each visit and enjoyed everything we played.) The fact that staff explain the games to you really took the pressure off.  We didn't try any food. We ordered a variety of coffee drinks, craft beers, and teas. Everyone was satisfied with their orders. Staff served us promptly and with no mix-ups.  Our guests are already looking forward to visiting Bonus Round the next time they're in Chicago, and we're sure we'll stop by again ourselves! (I've got my eye on the Bob Ross board game...) We had a wonderful time!

Just had a great experience here. Drew made my gf and I feel very welcomed. He picked out the perfect game based on what we said we were looking for. He explained the rules for the fairly complicated game, but made it easy to start out- it would have taken hours to figure out if we were reading the rules at home. He stopped by to answer any questions we had about the game. The coffee was good as well as the bang bang pie they sell. I’m really happy to have this great business nearby and really hope it succeeds. Will be back soon.
Fun place with alcoholic drinks
Extremely friendly staff members and owners, delicious coffee and fun games. Glad that this spot exists in Chicago.
Love the idea and the staff is very helpful and friendly!
Great hidden Gem!  Drink some beer/wine and play board games.
Amazingly friendly and helpful staff and awesome selection of games!
An inclusive and welcoming place with a great selection of games and good food.
Good coffee, affordable drinks, knowledgeable staff. This is an awesome place to go and check out some new games!

Just got done with one of the best gaming experiences of my life. Came from out of town, and convinced some less gaming-savvy friends to join me, and I have to say,  Drew and  Courtney were SPOT on with their hospitality.  Drew recommended the best games for us to break out,  and taught us with no problem. These kids are SAVVY, and they've made a wonderful hangout place for gamers of all stripes. If you have the slightest inkling of giving this place out, do it. You will not be disappoint.
Great staff! Los of drink and snack options to go with the fun board games!
Great experience! Owners are attentive and help to teach the games! Never seen that before!

I've been here twice since the grand opening and I'm planning on making it a regular haunt. There's great games, friendly staff, excellent food and coffee and if you're new to tabletop gaming they'll actually help you find a game you'll love to try and help you learn it. Three cheers for this place!

Drew and this whole place are awesome! I stopped in with some friends after the cubs game was snowed out on Monday. He was super helpful in helping us find a game that none of us had played. He even spent time explaining everything to us and answering any questions we had. I would recommend this place to everyone.
Fantastic location and wonderful coffee. Bunker down and board game up, dudes!
Super friendly and knowledgeable staff. Good cappuccino and a fun selection of sodas. We’ve been a couple times now and had a great time every visit.

There's no other place like this in Chicago. The cappuccinos and lattes are great and the people are super friendly. Drew helped our group pick a game and explained all the rules to get us started - he was extremely helpful and we loved how enthusiastic he was about the game and about the cafe's success (we stumbled upon this place on their second weekend and it was booming the entire 3 hours we were there). They have a very wide and unique selection of board games, most of them we had never heard of. If you have a hard time picking one ask for suggestions - they know their stuff! Multiple times we had questions about the game rules and someone was always available to help. We had a great time and will definitely be back. Looking forward to supporting a business as awesome as this one!

Great unique place. I suggest coming this month to test the place out while they have free Game Pass due to Kickstarter. That deal ends 4/1. I also recommend coming with at least one friend because when I came around 10pm all people already had their own games set up.It seems to be a place to bring your own friends to play with vs just coming to play with other people. Plusses is this place has coffee and cafe food(sandwiches, soup). If you want a full bowl of soup dont order from this place because they give you a half bowl. I would not have noticed but either they need to change their portion sizes or give me a smaller bowl. The servers are great at suggesting games to play in addition to food. They also tell you how to play the games they recommend.So definitely worth the game pass cost.

Popped in purely by accident and ended up spending like 4 hours here. What a fantastic concept and it looks like it's being done right.   Listen to the game recommendation because you just might be pleasantly surprised like I was. The employees were super nice and amazing when it came to explaining games. Love to play board games but hate trying to figure out the manual? This is the place for you! Wish I lived here because I would be a regularly.

The staff are really friendly and take the time to explain games if you want to learn something new. There's a really great selection of different games, including both solo and larger group games to play.
Good game selection and great staff!

Had a great time! Owners were really invested in their customers and took the time to explain the games to us. A great place to chill with friends and play a lot of unique board games. Would definitely recommend!
The owners care so much about their community and building a welcoming space for their clientele. Would firmly recommend this place for anyone looking for somewhere to connect with great people.
